channel.title: Saw iv
channel.description:
I have still failed to see any of the movies except for the end of one dem.
Although, I'm going to watch all of them at once. I just saw the first commercial for SAW IV, I'm looking forward to how they play this without the main guy behind it :(

item.title: Saw iv
item.dc:creator: @Dregen Dregen
item.description:
@Dregen wrote:

To be honest, I don’t really think Saw IV will be that good. I mean, it feels really cheap that they are making yet another sequel, when the third was a good enough ending to the plot. And also, without the main guy in it, it will have a somewhat different feel.

But, then again, I could be wrong. This may be another mischievous link to the current plot, and add more suspense. I dunno. I’m probably going to watch it anyways. I mean, right when the movie comes out in stores, my dad is gonna get it. He likes the Saw movies, basically because he just loves scary and gory movies (My mom don’t like the Saw series though, she says it is absolutely sick. Haha…) I like the Saw movies, maybe even love them, but my gut just can’t take it. When I watched the last movie, after it was over, I had terrible nausea. I don’t think it was as worse as it was after I watched the first movie though.

I haven’t seen a commercial for it yet, but my brother has. I’ll have to check out some channels and try to find a commercial and see what it looks like.

Read full topic

item.title: Saw iv
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

Why the sad face .Flair? Cheer up!

Anyway, I can tell you that the previous three Saw films are all worth watching. It’s a great story line and I’m looking forward to Saw IV. I strongly suggest that anyone that’s planning on the watching Saw IV watch Saw I, II, and III before. Otherwise Saw IV might not make a lot of sense.

I also suggest you pay attention while watching them, .Flair, so you don’t miss anything. Shouldn’t be hard, they’re good movies.

Read full topic
